commit message:
No longer build for Vodaphone store.

What a waste of time that was.
Target Android 5.0, require at least API 11.
Move menu into XML, action bar.

Get rid of v4 support library.

We have dropped support and can now use the official functions.

Add modern icons.

Highdef icons from Android 5 default assets, via AndroidAssetStudio.

Use the Android default theme.

With material design, it seems Android might be converging, and anyway, I haven't
seen a system theme so far that I am really happy with (currently being annoyed by
the Sony Z1).

Move filter options to action bar submenu.

No separate dialog is used anymore.

Increase list right padding for scrollbar.

Seems it started to take quite a bit of space in recent Android versions.

Possibly android:scrollbarStyle='outsideOverlay' or something similar would
be smarter, but I couldn't get it to work - it seems to impact the rendering
such that the separator lines between our items end early.

New highres info icon.

Remove the colored version, instead rely on 5.0 tint. Older versions
will lack a highlight color.

Remove 'loading...' text.

As per Android design guidelines:
http://developer.android.com/design/building-blocks/progress.html

Prevent unnamed receivers from hiding.

I am surprised they can even exist.

Get rid of another v4 compat class.

Now that we no longer support v4, we don't need it anymore.

Get rid of our custom FastScroller workaround, too.

I have to believe that this has no been fixed in Android proper. Certainly,
the FastScroller has been rewritten, and this is liable to cause problems
at some point.

Revert 'Get rid of our custom FastScroller workaround, too.'

Turns out, the bug still exists!

This reverts commit dacd6b4c8ca9de8a771a514e67f564e05033eeb7.
Merge new strings from app into .po files.
